item.title: “If our teachers have to put their lives on the line, then...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

“If our teachers have to put their lives on the line, then I’m willing to do the same,”

Board member Tay Anderson said it seems hypocritical for the board to continue to meet on Zoom while asking teachers and students to return to classrooms.

co.chalkbeat.org

Denver school board member: If students meet in person, the board should too

Board member Tay Anderson said it seems hypocritical for the board to continue to meet on Zoom while asking teachers and students to return to classrooms.Board member Tay Anderson said it seems hypocritical for the board to continue to meet on Zoom while asking teachers and students to return to classrooms.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Today I began working back in the DPS building. I walked to my...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Today I began working back in the DPS building.

I walked to my mailbox and someone mailed this letter to my office. I am disgusted ... furthermore I am grateful for our Safety and Security teams at Denver Public Schools immediately responding to this and opening up an investigation.

Regardless of political differences, THIS IS NOT OKAY.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Leaders must lead with BOLD actions. I told the Superintendent...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Leaders must lead with BOLD actions.

I told the Superintendent that if there is a paraprofessional or an RJ Coordinator that needed a sub, I’d be willing to volunteer my time in our schools since I have experience in both roles prior to my time as one of the Directors on the School Board.

#DPSSTRONG #ForTheStudents
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: Tomorrow will be my first day back at the DPS headquarters since...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Tomorrow will be my first day back at the DPS headquarters since closing our schools in March.

I have committed to going back to work for our students and staff in-person since they will be asked to do the same.

I hope that my colleagues will begin to join me.

...

#ForTheStudents

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: The reason why I had to use my voice and run for office wasn’t...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

The reason why I had to use my voice and run for office wasn’t because I wanted to be in the spotlight, it was simply because I got tired of those who looked like me not representing me. Sometimes, it’s even our own people that are doing wrong to us that are not fighting for us.

Tay Anderson tackles big city issues as the new Denver School Board At-Large Director in order to end generational inequity.

myblackcolorado.com

Tay Anderson - My Black Colorado

Tay Anderson tackles big city issues as the new Denver School Board At-Large Director in order to end generational inequity.Tay Anderson tackles big city issues as the new Denver School Board At-Large Director in order to end generational inequity.

item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: This Facebook group described folks that use pronouns and those...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

This Facebook group described folks that use pronouns and those in the LGBTQIA+ community with terms as “sexual fantasies” and “mental illnesses.”

We must be better than this. Denver Public Schools will always be an inclusive school district.

It was before I was elected and will be when I’m gone. We will always reject transphobia, homophobia, and bigotry.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

THIS!

Hunger Free Colorado

Households can get up to $279 (per eligible child) in benefits to buy food. Apply by 9/23! Immigration status does not matter for P-EBT and P-EBT is not part of the public charge rule.
Learn more: HungerFreeColorado.org/p-ebt/
Apply online: ColoradoPeak.secure.force.com/PEBT

item.title: Seriously Governor? The author of SB191 will chair this...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Seriously Governor?

The author of SB191 will chair this committee? So much for public education.

Jared Polis

“...RISE will foster new models of learning, ideas to better the educational experience of college students, and ways to strengthen the connections between high school, college, and careers.”

Gov. Jared Polis hopes RISE will foster new models of learning, ideas to better the educational experience of college students, and ways to strengthen the connections between high school, college and careers.

co.chalkbeat.org

Polis launches fund to better Colorado education during pandemic

item.title: Good, I’m looking forward to safe games in the spring.
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

Good, I’m looking forward to safe games in the spring.

The Colorado High School Activities Association met Tuesday night to discuss a potential change in its plan to push football and several other fall sports to the spring, but the CHSAA board of directors voted against reversing course and decided it won't try to have a season this semester.

thedenverchannel.com

CHSAA decides against bringing football back for the fall, despite green light from Polis

The Colorado High School Activities Association met Tuesday night to discuss a potential change in its plan to push football and several other fall sports to the spring, but the CHSAA board of directors voted against reversing course and decided it won't try to have a season this semester.The Colorado High School Activities Association met Tuesday night to discuss a potential change in its plan to push football and several other fall sports to the spring, but the CHSAA board of directors voted against reversing course and decided it won't try to have a season this semester.

item.title: ECE is open and schools are set to return to in-person learning...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

ECE is open and schools are set to return to in-person learning soon, I plan to follow our Superintendent and be present in our downtown office building for all of our School Board meetings.

I can’t ask students and educators to risk their safety if I’m not willing to risk mine.

I understand some of my colleagues aren’t able to do this, but I encourage those that can to show up and let’s hold in-person meetings or find a hybrid model like city council.

...

If Councilwoman Candi CdeBaca can show up for her constituents in the chamber, so can I.

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: THIS
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

THIS

James Coleman

I know we all expect this type of weather in Colorado, but let’s take a moment to care for the members of our community who have no shelter today. #TakeCareofOneAnother
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: School districts should NOT meet via zoom to determine if...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

School districts should NOT meet via zoom to determine if students should be back for in-person learning.

If it’s not safe for you to hold a meeting then it’s not safe for students and educators to return.

I said what I said.
item.author: Tay Anderson

item.title: I see you I hear you I will work to change policy to protect...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

I see you
I hear you
I will work to change policy to protect you.

It’s long overdue that we teach comprehensive sex education starting with our youngest learners, we work on dismantling the current dress code, and that we teach a mandatory consent program in our schools.

The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.

denver.cbslocal.com|By CBS Denver

100+ High School Students In Denver Protest For Better Sex Education Amid Sex Assault Allegations

The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.The demand for change comes after several allegations of sexual assault surfaced this week against several East High School students.

item.title: As we enter the 2020 - 2021 school year, Director Anderson is...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

As we enter the 2020 - 2021 school year, Director Anderson is re-establishing his community cabinet.

This is a space for parents, organizations, students, educators and community members to have a seat at the table and help influence policy. This group will help set Director Andersons' 2020-2021 goals as a member of the Denver School Board.

item.title: *** Social Media Policy *** Guidelines for functioning in an...
item.content:encoded:
Denver School Board Director - Tay Anderson

*** Social Media Policy ***

Guidelines for functioning in an electronic world are the same as the values, ethics and respectability policies expected to live every day. You can expect discussions on many topics and many viewpoints in my posts. You can also expect the following:

*Engagement in healthy, open and honest dialogues

...

*Welcoming of constructive criticism

*Corrections of inaccurate or misleading postings

*Deletion of posts that are spam, inappropriate, defamatory, use profanity, and/or otherwise offensive

*An understanding that respect goes both ways — I will use good judgment in my posts and respond to you in a respectful manner. In return, I ask the same of you. (If instances of bullying and/or harassment take place, I may unfriend, block and or report the matter to Facebook, depending on the seriousness of the situation.)

*Honoring of our differences — I will not tolerate discrimination (including age, sex, race, color, creed, religion, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, disability, or marital status or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local laws, regulations or ordinances).

For further questions on this policy please email me at Tay_Anderson@dpsk12.org

See More
item.author: Tay Anderson
